raw_text:
Ferguson hails Man Utd's resolve
 
 Manchester United's Alex Ferguson has praised his players' gutsy performance in the 1-0 win at Aston Villa.
 
 "That was our hardest away game of the season and it was a fantastic game of football, end-to-end with lots of good passing," said the Old Trafford boss. "We showed lots of character and guts and we weren't going to lose. "I look at that fixture and think we've been there and won, while Arsenal and Chelsea have yet to come and Villa may have some players back when they do." Ferguson also hailed senior stars Ryan Giggs and Roy Keane, who came off the bench for the injured John O'Shea. "Roy came on and brought a bit of composure to the midfield which we needed and which no other player has got. "Giggs was a tremendous threat and he brings tremendous penetration. "All we can do is maintain our form, play as we are and we'll get our rewards."

smollm:1.7b: Ferguson hails Manchester United's resolve in the 1-0 win at Aston Villa. The original text is an interview with Alex Ferguson at Manchester United. It starts by praising Man Utd's players' hard-fought performance in a 1-0 win against Aston Villa. Then it goes into details about their strategy and the team's overall strength, mentioning specific players like Giggs and Keane.

I need to extract the key points. The main ideas are that Ferguson praised his team's resilience and character, highlighted the quality of their players, mentioned some notable substitutions and their impact, and emphasized their determination for future games.

I should make sure to include all these elements but keep it concise. I'll focus on the winning game as a highlight since it's specific to the text. Then mention the key points about strategy, substitution, and player contributions without getting too detailed into other aspects like Arsenal or Chelsea's schedules.

Let me structure this: start with Ferguson's praise for the team's resilience, then talk about the specific match details, substitutions, and what they mean for their future games.
</think>

Ferguson hails Manchester United's resilience in a hard-fought 1-0 victory against Aston Villa.

tinydolphin:1.1b: In summary, Manchester United manager Alex Ferguson praised the resilience of his players in their recent away win against Aston Villa. He commended them for showing great grit and determination throughout the match, including the heroics of Ryan Giggs and Roy Keane who came off the bench to provide crucial support. Ferguson also emphasized the importance of maintaining his team's current form in order to seal their playoff chances.

Senior players Ryan Giggs and Roy Keane played key roles, with Giggs being a threat to the opposing team and Keane bringing composure to the midfield. Ferguson emphasized the importance of maintaining their form and playing as they are for future success.
